Judul: THREE-COORDINATE FORMAL COBALT(0), IRON(0), AND MANGANESE(0) COMPLEXES WITH PERSISTENT CARBENE AND ALKENE LIGATION
Abstrak:
Low-coordinate transition-metal species, i.e., metal species with
coordination numbers of less than 4, represent a category of ubiquitous reactive
intermediates in metal-catalyzed reactions that take place in solution, in
metalloenzymes, on supported nanomaterials and single-atom catalysts, and so
on. While reactive intermediates are usually transient and hard to isolate, which
makes detailed investigation challenging, molecular representatives of lowcoordinate
transition-metal intermediates can be synthesized by the judicious use
of supporting ligands, allowing detailed study of their inherent chemical and
physical properties. By the use of bulky nitrogen- and oxygen-based anionic
ligands, plenty of three- and two-coordinate group 4?10 metal complexes ..
